Key Match Events: Youri Tielemans gave Belgium a flying start with a goal from the edge of the area in the second minute.
Kevin De Bruyne effectively killed the game off in the 80th after converting direct from Belgium goalkeeper Koen Casteels' long kick.
Pre-Game Insights: Belgium was looking to respond to their opening game loss to Slovakia and shake off the shock of being eliminated at the group stage of the 2022 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium got its European Championship campaign up and running after beating Romania 2-0, with all four teams in Group E having three points, meaning there is all to play for in the final round of games on Wednesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Romelu Lukaku had a third goal ruled out by VAR at these Euros, but was at the center of his team's great start when laying the ball off for Tielemans to score.
Others: The format of the Euros, in which the four best third-place teams advance, leaves more room for error, but with memories of Qatar still fresh, another defeat would have broken the confidence of a team criticized for failing to live up to expectations in the past.
